dict.string:
#!/bin/bash
if [ "$action" != "add" ]; then IFS=$'\n'
files=($(ls "${folder_path}"/*.md)) files_list=$(printf '%s\\n' "${files[@]}") fi
if [ "$is_url" = "1" ]; then title=$(curl -s ${add_item} | grep -o '<title>[^<]*</title>' | head -n 1 | sed -e 's/<title>\(.*\)<\/title>/\1/' -e 's/^[[:space:]]*//' -e 's/[[:space:]]*$//') fi
printf '{"alfredworkflow": {"arg": "", "variables": {"page_title": "%s", "files_list": "%s"}}}' "$title" "$files_list"
Currently opened tab in a frontmost browser

#!/bin/bash
IFS=$'\n'
files=($(ls "${folder_path}"/*.md)) files_list=$(printf '%s\\n' "${files[@]}")
IFS=$'\t' read -r title url <<< "{query}"
printf '{"alfredworkflow": {"arg": "", "variables": {"page_title": "%s", "add_item": "%s", "files_list": "%s", "as_checkbox": "false"}}}' "$title" "$url" "$files_list"

![Bookmark Vault](./icon.png)
# Bookmark Vault Workflow that helps you manage your links and quick search notes.
[Description](https://github.com/colomolo/alfred-bookmarks)
Add frontmost browser's tab url to the list
Markdown files will be created here
